definition: to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: The Nazi war criminals were condemned for crimes against humanity.
sentences.chinese: 纳粹战犯因其灭绝人性的罪行而被判刑。

sentences.english: Previous demonstrations have seen reenactments of alleged Nazi war crimes.
sentences.chinese: 而之前的那些游行里也能看到对所谓纳粹战犯的扮演。

sentences.english: Executing these war criminals 10,000 times would not atone for their sins.
sentences.chinese: 即使这些甲级战犯死一万遍也不能洗刷他们的罪恶。

sentences.english: The Japanese leaders insisted on visiting the Yasukuni Shrine that worships Class-A war criminals during World War II.
sentences.chinese: 日本领导人坚持参拜供奉甲级战犯的靖国神社。

sentences.english: The old war criminal is at last smoked out from his hiding place abroad.
sentences.chinese: 战犯终于被人从他在国外的藏匿处查获。

sentences.english: Three inmates who attacked a Bosnian Serb war criminal in a British jail have been given additional prison sentences.
sentences.chinese: 在英国监狱中袭击波斯湾战犯的三名囚犯被加刑。

sentences.english: Many war criminals are still living in South Africa under false names.
sentences.chinese: 许多战犯仍用假名字住在南非。

sentences.english: Some argue that trying to arrest such war criminals gets in the way of peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 有人坚持认为，试图逮捕这些战犯阻碍了和平谈判。

sentences.english: Their search is the last gasp of the post-war hunt for Nazi war criminals.
sentences.chinese: 警方的搜捕表明战后抓捕纳粹战犯的硝烟未散。
